name: Thirty-Minute Baked Tuna Burgers
author: Jonathan Johnson
summary: This is a dish my parents used to be able to make in a half hour when we were children. I added a few additions to make it a little more exciting and fairly low in fat. Serve on hamburger buns with traditional hamburger condiments if desired.
ingredients: 2 (5 ounce) cans tuna in water, drained
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray
Mix tuna, egg, bread crumbs, garlic salt, and black pepper and fold in diced tomatoes and onion
Form the mixture into 4 patties and place onto prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until burgers are golden brown and crisp, about 10 minutes per side
